abstract_summ: TREC-COVID, in creating a test collection around COVID-19 literature, is building infrastructure to support new research and technologies in pandemic search.Significance Statement In this paper, we show how to apply an unique information mining method lexical link analysis (LLA) to link unstructured (CORD-19) and structured (Next Strain) data sets to relevant publications, integrate text and data mining into a single platform to discover the insights that can be visualized, and validated to answer the high-priority questions of genetics, incubation, treatment, symptoms, and prevention of COVID-19.The flood of conflicting COVID-19 research has revealed that COVID-19 continues to be an enigma.In this paper, we present our ongoing work on SciSight, a novel framework for exploratory search of COVID-19 research.In this paper, we present our ongoing work on SciSight, a novel framework for exploratory search of COVID-19 research.While most research in search engines is performed in the academic field of information retrieval (IR), most academic search engines--though rigorously evaluated--are sparsely utilized, while major commercial web search engines (e.g., Google, Bing) dominate.

Natural Language Processing based Automatic Literature Mining and Research Summarization for Early-Stage Comprehension in Pandemic Situations specifically for COVID-19Machine Learning Maps Research Needs in COVID-19 LiteratureCORD-19: The Covid-19 Open Research Dataset.COVID-19 Case StudyA Semantically Enriched Dataset based on Biomedical NER for the COVID19 Open Research Dataset ChallengeDocument Classification for COVID-19 LiteratureSearching Scientific Literature for Answers on COVID-19 QuestionsCORD-19: The COVID-19 Open Research DatasetSciSight: Combining faceted navigation and research group detection for COVID-19 exploratory scientific searchVisualization of Diseases at Risk in the COVID-19 LiteratureTREC-COVID: Constructing a Pandemic Information Retrieval Test CollectionEnglish dictionaries, gold and silver standard corpora for biomedical natural language processing related to SARS-CoV-2 and COVID-19An Evaluation of Publicly Available Deep LearningBased Commercial Information Retrieval Systems to search Biomedical Articles related to COVID-19Rapidly Deploying a Neural Search Engine for the COVID-19 Open Research Dataset: Preliminary Thoughts and Lessons LearnedCOVID-19Base: A knowledgebase to explore biomedical entities related to COVID-19Automatic Text Summarization of COVID-19 Medical Research Articles using BERT and GPT-2Answering Questions on COVID-19 in Real-TimeConstructing Co-occurrence Network Embeddings to Assist Association Extraction for COVID-19 and Other Coronavirus Infectious DiseasesTREC-COVID: Rationale and Structure of an Information Retrieval Shared Task for COVID-19Getting Insights from a Large Corpus of Scientific Papers on Specialisted Comprehensive Topics -- the Case of COVID-19A Semantic Web Framework for Automated Smart Assistants:
title_abstract_phrases: SciSight: Combining faceted navigation and research group detection for COVID-19 exploratory scientific searchThe COVID-19 pandemic has sparked unprecedented mobilization of scientists, already generating thousands of new papers that join a litany of previous biomedical work in related areas.We hope this resource will continue to bring together the computing community, biomedical experts, and policy makers in the search for effective treatments and management policies for COVID-19.SciSight: Combining faceted navigation and research group detection for COVID-19 exploratory scientific searchThe COVID-19 pandemic has sparked unprecedented mobilization of scientists, already generating thousands of new papers that join a litany of previous biomedical work in related areas.Significance Statement In this paper, we show how to apply an unique information mining method lexical link analysis (LLA) to link unstructured (CORD-19) and structured (Next Strain) data sets to relevant publications, integrate text and data mining into a single platform to discover the insights that can be visualized, and validated to answer the high-priority questions of genetics, incubation, treatment, symptoms, and prevention of COVID-19.CovidNLP: A Web Application for Distilling Systemic Implications of COVID-19 Pandemic with Natural Language ProcessingThe flood of conflicting COVID-19 research has revealed that COVID-19 continues to be an enigma.TREC-COVID, in creating a test collection around COVID-19 literature, is building infrastructure to support new research and technologies in pandemic search.Proper investigation of the mined biomedical entities along with the identified interactions among those, reported in COVID-19Base, would help the research community to discover possible ways for the therapeutic treatment of COVID-19.Automatic Text Summarization of COVID-19 Medical Research Articles using BERT and GPT-2With the COVID-19 pandemic, there is a growing urgency for medical community to keep up with the accelerating growth in the new coronavirus-related literature.
